1: <sup>1</sup> After these things Jesus shewed himself again to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias; and on this wise shewed he himself.
2: <sup>2</sup> There were together Simon Peter, and Thomas called Didymus, and Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, and the sons of Zebedee, and two other of his disciples.
3: <sup>3</sup> Simon Peter saith unto them, I go a fishing. They say unto him, We also go with thee. They went forth, and entered into a ship immediately; and that night they caught nothing.
4: <sup>4</sup> But when the morning was now come, Jesus stood on the shore: but the disciples knew not that it was Jesus.
5: <sup>5</sup> Then Jesus saith unto them, Children, have ye any meat? They answered him, No.
6: <sup>6</sup> And he said unto them, Cast the net on the right side of the ship, and ye shall find. They cast therefore, and now they were not able to draw it for the multitude of fishes.
7: <sup>7</sup> Therefore that disciple whom Jesus loved saith unto Peter, It is the Lord. Now when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he girt his fisher’s coat unto him, (for he was naked,) and did cast himself into the sea.
8: <sup>8</sup> And the other disciples came in a little ship; (for they were not far from land, but as it were two hundred cubits,) dragging the net with fishes.
9: <sup>9</sup> As soon then as they were come to land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid thereon, and bread.
10: <sup>10</sup> Jesus saith unto them, Bring of the fish which ye have now caught.
11: <sup>11</sup> Simon Peter went up, and drew the net to land full of great fishes, an hundred and fifty and three: and for all there were so many, yet was not the net broken.
12: <sup>12</sup> Jesus saith unto them, Come and dine. And none of the disciples durst ask him, Who art thou? knowing that it was the Lord.
13: <sup>13</sup> Jesus then cometh, and taketh bread, and giveth them, and fish likewise.
14: <sup>14</sup> This is now the third time that Jesus shewed himself to his disciples, after that he was risen from the dead.
15: <sup>15</sup> So when they had dined, Jesus saith to Simon Peter, Simon, son of Jonas, lovest thou me more than these? He saith unto him, Yea, Lord; thou knowest that I love thee. He saith unto him, Feed my lambs.
16: <sup>16</sup> He saith to him again the second time, Simon, son of Jonas, lovest thou me? He saith unto him, Yea, Lord; thou knowest that I love thee. He saith unto him, Feed my sheep.
17: <sup>17</sup> He saith unto him the third time, Simon, son of Jonas, lovest thou me? Peter was grieved because he said unto him the third time, Lovest thou me? And he said unto him, Lord, thou knowest all things; thou knowest that I love thee. Jesus saith unto him, Feed my sheep.
18: <sup>18</sup> Verily, verily, I say unto thee, When thou wast young, thou girdest thyself, and walkedst whither thou wouldest: but when thou shalt be old, thou shalt stretch forth thy hands, and another shall gird thee, and carry thee whither thou wouldest not.
19: <sup>19</sup> This spake he, signifying by what death he should glorify God. And when he had spoken this, he saith unto him, Follow me.
20: <sup>20</sup> Then Peter, turning about, seeth the disciple whom Jesus loved following; which also leaned on his breast at supper, and said, Lord, which is he that betrayeth thee?
21: <sup>21</sup> Peter seeing him saith to Jesus, Lord, and what shall this man do?
22: <sup>22</sup> Jesus saith unto him, If I will that he tarry till I come, what is that to thee? follow thou me.
23: <sup>23</sup> Then went this saying abroad among the brethren, that that disciple should not die: yet Jesus said not unto him, He shall not die; but, If I will that he tarry till I come, what is that to thee?
24: <sup>24</sup> This is the disciple which testifieth of these things, and wrote these things: and we know that his testimony is true.
25: <sup>25</sup> And there are also many other things which Jesus did, the which, if they should be written every one, I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that should be written. Amen.
26: <sup>26</sup> Men’s hearts failing them for fear, and for looking after those things which are coming on the earth: for the powers of heaven shall be shaken.
27: <sup>27</sup> And then shall they see the Son of man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
28: <sup>28</sup> And when these things begin to come to pass, then look up, and lift up your heads; for your redemption draweth nigh.
29: <sup>29</sup> And he spake to them a parable; Behold the fig tree, and all the trees;
30: <sup>30</sup> When they now shoot forth, ye see and know of your own selves that summer is now nigh at hand.
31: <sup>31</sup> So likewise ye, when ye see these things come to pass, know ye that the kingdom of God is nigh at hand.
32: <sup>32</sup> Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not pass away, till all be fulfilled.
33: <sup>33</sup> Heaven and earth shall pass away: but my words shall not pass away.
34: <sup>34</sup> And take heed to yourselves, lest at any time your hearts be overcharged with surfeiting, and drunkenness, and cares of this life, and so that day come upon you unawares.
35: <sup>35</sup> For as a snare shall it come on all them that dwell on the face of the whole earth.
36: <sup>36</sup> Watch ye therefore, and pray always, that ye may be accounted worthy to escape all these things that shall come to pass, and to stand before the Son of man.
37: <sup>37</sup> And in the day time he was teaching in the temple; and at night he went out, and abode in the mount that is called the mount of Olives.
38: <sup>38</sup> And all the people came early in the morning to him in the temple, for to hear him.
39: <sup>39</sup> And they caught him, and cast him out of the vineyard, and slew him.
40: <sup>40</sup> When the lord therefore of the vineyard cometh, what will he do unto those husbandmen?
41: <sup>41</sup> They say unto him, He will miserably destroy those wicked men, and will let out his vineyard unto other husbandmen, which shall render him the fruits in their seasons.
42: <sup>42</sup> Jesus saith unto them, Did ye never read in the scriptures, The stone which the builders rejected, the same is become the head of the corner: this is the Lord’s doing, and it is marvellous in our eyes?
43: <sup>43</sup> Therefore say I unto you, The kingdom of God shall be taken from you, and given to a nation bringing forth the fruits thereof.
44: <sup>44</sup> And whosoever shall fall on this stone shall be broken: but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will grind him to powder.
45: <sup>45</sup> And when the chief priests and Pharisees had heard his parables, they perceived that he spake of them.
46: <sup>46</sup> But when they sought to lay hands on him, they feared the multitude, because they took him for a prophet.
